pull.title: test: Check that a block rejected due to too-new time is later accepted in p2p_invalid_block
pull.body:
I was unsure if the code sufficiently avoided caching a time-too-new rejection, so wrote this test to check it.

It looks like despite only exempting `BLOCK_MUTATED`, it is still okay because header failures never cache block invalidity.

This test will help ensure that if this ever changes, `BLOCK_TIME_FUTURE` gets excluded at the same time.

Note: Branch is a clean merge to 0.19 and master

events.message:
QA: p2p_invalid_block: Check that a block rejected due to too-new time is later accepted

I was unsure if the code sufficiently avoided caching a time-too-new rejection, so wrote this test to check it.
It looks like despite only exempting BLOCK_MUTATED, it is still okay because header failures never cache block invalidity.
This test will help ensure that if this ever changes, BLOCK_TIME_FUTURE gets excluded at the same time.

events.body: ACK with nits, mostly comment-related. It seems like `feature_block.py` and `mining_basic.py` both test too-new blocks but don't check that they're accepted later. I'm not sure what the difference is between `invalid_block.py` and `feature_block.py`; what's the reasoning for putting it here?

rename.from: QA: p2p_invalid_block: Check that a block rejected due to too-new time is later accepted
rename.to: test: Check that a block rejected due to too-new time is later accepted in p2p_invalid_block

events.body: Two concept ACKs, but this needs review comments addressing, added "waiting for author".
Basically two months since the last ping and "waiting for author" addition. Going to close this as "up for grabs" if anyone wants to pick it up.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -133,5 +134,20 @@ def run_test(self):
         self.log.info("Test inflation by duplicating input")
         node.p2p.send_blocks_and_test([block4], node, success=False,  reject_reason='bad-txns-inputs-duplicate')
 
+
+        self.log.info("Test accepting identical block after rejecting it due to a future timestamp.")
+
+        t = int(time.time())
+        node.setmocktime(t)
+        block = create_block(tip, create_coinbase(height), t + 7201)
+        block.hashMerkleRoot = block.calc_merkle_root()
+        block.solve()
+        # NOTE: Need force_send because the block will get rejected without a getdata otherwise
+        node.p2p.send_blocks_and_test([block], node, force_send=True, success=False, reject_reason='time-too-new')#, expect_disconnect=True)
+        #self.reconnect_p2p()

comments.body: Should update description to include the added test?

comments.body: Stray in-line comment, and I'm pretty sure we don't expect disconnect?
